body.p:
To his Excellency,
Hon, B. Magoffin Govr of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your petitioners neighbours, acquaintances & friends of John Sorrell: state that, at the last term of the July (1860) chancery & Criminal Court for Fleming County, said John Sorrell was fined the sum of $10, for playing cards, & looseing & winning more than 20$ at he same time, fined $66,75/100 for unlawful gameing: And at the same time fined $50 for unlawful gameing.

Mr Sorrell was unable to attend Court & no plea was interposed for him. hence his finds. Mr Saml Littell was indi^c^ted in the same indictments & was acquitted, no proof being adduced, by the Commonwealth sufficient to show his guilt. -- no plea in -- a Jury was empanneled & without proof under the Law found a Verdict of Guilty, as above stated against said Sorell.

Mr Sorell, is a farmer, and an industrious man -- has a Wife & four little Children to support; We are glad to say that, he has quit gameing for the last 2 years. & say he will never throw a Card againe --

He can pay the Costs of sd Suit; But the Fines will be oppressive in the extrem upon him & his industrious wife, & deprive his innocent children of the absolute necessarys of life, Thes facts we humbly present
to your Excellency ^& verily^ believe that, the dignity of the Law will be maintained, & the infraction sufficiently punished if by mercy ^being^ is extended to him,
Therefore, We unite in his behalf, & do pray your Excellency will remit all of said fine, except the cost, which he will pay promptly, & as in duty bound ever pray.

Very Respectfully.
